Place the onions on the countertop next to the shopping bag and next to the oranges.
Put bag of herbs on the counter top next to the oranges.
Pour hot water from the kettle into the bowl. This is the start of the prep for testing the yeast.
Pour cold water from the jug into the bowl, trying to produce a lukewarm water for the yeast by mixing hot and warm water.
Pour some of the water into the sink. The water is still too hot and the bowl is nearly full. So emptying the current content to add more cold water.
Put down the lid of the sugar jar on the countertop using the right hand, flipping it upside down so as any sugar on the inside of the lid would not fall onto the surface of the countertop.
Pour the spoons content into the bowl with lukewarm water.
Using the spoon in the right hand, mix the water with the sugar to dissolve it by moving the spoon in circular motions small and large clockwise.
Pour the yeast into the bowl.

Push any remaining undissolved yeast onto the side of the bowl to help it dissolve with the spoon.
Mix again the content of the bowl by stirring. So all the yeast dissolves in water.
Hit the spoon on the rim of the bowl a few times to remove any stuck yeast on it.
Hold the lower bowl in the stack using the left hand, then remove the upper smaller bowl from using the right hand.
Place the glass pointing up inside the upper bowl to use it to measure flour.

Pick the glass filled with flour from the countertop.
Put down the glass on top of the pile of flour inside the bowl so as to measure more flour.
Pour more flour into the glass inside the bowl to measure a second cup of flour.

Pick up the full red bag of flour that has been bought with the grocery from the countertop using both hands.
Pour flour from the red bag into the glass that is inside the big bowl to measure a third cup of flour shaking it as needed to pour more flour.

Pour salt from the bottle into the bowl containing flour to add salt to the flour mixture.

Mix the salt with the flour using the spoon, holding the bowl with the left hand, and moving piles of flour and salt with the spoon using the right hand.

Turn the plate upright and place it on the countertop next to the bowl, having confirmed the yeast fermentation has completed. The yeast has grown and there are clear air bubbles.
Move the bowl of flour and dry mixture slightly on the countertop.
Using the spoon, create a small gap in the flour to pour liquids.
Keep holding the lid with the left hand and pour oil from the bottle into the bowl that contains flour, pouring it in the center.

Pour the content of the bowl into the bigger bowl with flour and oil, thus adding water, yeast and sugar into the mixture. These are the wet components of the dough.
Using the spoon, mix the dry components, flour, and the wet components, water and oil.

Remove the part of the mixture that is stuck on the spoon using the fingers by sliding it. Hold two fingers against the spoon. Pass them through the surface of the spoon to remove the mixture stuck on the spoon.
Continue mixing the mixture by hand, trying to mix all the ingredients together in a homogeneous manner.
Pour a bit of water from the jug into the bowl with mixture. The dough needs a little bit more hydration.
Mix the mixture into a dough, moving parts of it from the sides to the center and squeezing parts with fingers.
Pour a little more water into the bowl. The dough still needs more hydration.
Continue mixing and kneading the dough.
Pick up the bowl with dough.
Place the bowl with dough on another countertop, giving more space to move the bowl.
Continue kneading and mixing the dough.
Knead the dough while turning the bowl. Knead and then turn the bowl slightly clockwise and then knead again and turn again continuously.
Using the left hand, insert the hand into the bag and take a handful of flour from the bag.
Throw the handful of flour onto the dough mix. The dough is too wet, thus decreasing its wetness.
Combine the added flour with the dough by kneading and mixing.
Knead the dough while rotating the bowl clockwise.
Clear the hand from the stuck dough using the left hand scrape one finger at a time of the right hand to to get rid of the added dough and add it to the mixture
Continue kneading the dough, while turning the bowl clockwise.
Scrape the stuck dough on the right hand using the left hand by scraping one finger at a time.
Continue kneading the dough and turning the bowl clockwise.
Scrape the stuck dough on the hand using the other hand. One finger at a time.
wash hands off the stuck dough using the water from the tap, scrubbing both hands against one another.
On top of the sink, turn the the bowl upside down to empty some of the pink powder that has fallen inside it.
Hold the cap with the left hand, pour some oil from the bottle into the smaller bowl.

Using the right hand, gather the dough so as to pick it up from the bigger bowl.
Lift the bowl containing the dough and turn it upside down on top of the smaller bowl so as to slide the dough from it to the oiled bowl.
Slide the dough from the big bowl onto the small oiled bowl to prepare for its fermentation, using the right hand to assist in sliding any stuck parts of the dough.
Flatten the dough on the smaller oiled bowl using the right hand, by tapping it.
Pour olive oil from the bottle into the smaller bowl on top of the dough to cover it with oil.
Spread the poured oil on the surface of the dough to cover it using the right hand, by moving the hand around the dough inside the small bowl.
Rotate the small bowl using the left hand to help with spreading the oil evenly on the surface of the dough using the right hand.
Position the right hand on top of the bowl with the left hand, so any dripping oil from the hand would not fall on the floor, as the bowl and the hand are moved towards the sink to be washed.

Rinse the right hand off dough stuck to it by scrubbing both hands against one another, under the water from the tap. This action is performed on top of the empty bowl so the water off washing the hand is used to soak the bowl inside the sink.
Cover the bowl with dough using the blue towel. Using both hands, stretch the towel on top of the bowl, covering it fully, just stopping air from accessing the dough.
Cover the bowl which is already covered with the blue towel with the bigger white towel, again stopping the air from accessing the dough, during proofing.
Insert the bowl covered with towels inside the oven, sliding it in. Notice that the oven is actually switched off. This is just to leave the dough in a relatively warm place during proofing.

Pick up the other onion off the chopping board so as to center its location in preparing to chop it as well.

Once lifted, carefully hold the lid using the left hand, pinching it, avoiding touching any of the rim of the lid. Slide any of the condensed milk that is still attached to the inside of the cover using the knife, allowing it to fall back into the can. The lid will be discarded, so this is basically preserving some of the content of the can by sliding it back into the can using the knife. The lid is being held with the left hand and the knife is sliding the condensed milk down with the right hand.

Hold the wooden spoon again and stir the content of the pot. The butter has mostly melted and the butter has mixed with the cocoa powder, producing a chocolate saucy thing. Stirring in circular motions clockwise, then counterclockwise.
Write what I remember is the measurement of the butter next to the question mark on the notepad.
Hold the wooden spoon again and stir the content of the pot in circular motion.
Hold the wooden spoon on top of the pot observing whether the sauce is now boiling.
Continue stirring the content of the pot, using the wooden spoon in circular motions.
Pour the condensed milk from the can into the pot by holding the can with the left hand and tilting it on top of the pot so the condensed milk slowly falls into the pot.
Continue holding the can upside down on top of the pot so all the condensed milk which is thick keeps falling fully into the pot.
Mix the content of the pan, stirring the condensed milk into the mixture of butter and cocoa, using the wooden spoon in circular motions, quickly.
Once the condensed milk stops pouring from the can, tilt the can upright, carefully waiting for the dripping to stop.
Stir the content of the pot using the wooden spoon while holding the handle of the pot with the left hand until all the mixture is homogeneous and is one color, in circular motions clockwise.
Put the large chopping board on the countertop next to the bowl with the crushed biscuits.
Hit the wooden spoon against the rim of the pot to drop any of the sauce from it into the pot.
Wait for the sauce to boil.
Lift the lid off the pot with carrot soup and hold the lid on top of the pot so any condensed water will fall back into the pot using the left hand.
Stir the content of the soup only slightly.
Pick up one piece of carrot from the pot using the spatula, resting the piece on the spatula's edge to pick it up.
Place the piece of carrot on the plate, dropping it from the spatula.
break the piece of carrot using the spatula's edge into pieces to check how cooked the piece is.
Return the three broken pieces of the carrot onto the spatula using the left hand, pushing them with the finger back onto the spatula to return them to the pot.
drop the curved pieces back into the soup, hitting the spatula against the edge of the pot.
Hold the wooden spoon that's resting on the pot of the chocolate sauce again and stir the content of the pot using the right hand in circular motions.
Hit the wooden spoon on the edge of the pot to drop any of the sauce into the pot.
Turn off the hob by holding the dial with the left hand and rotating it clockwise to turn off the heat. The chocolate sauce is now ready.
pour the chocolate sauce into the white bowl with crushed biscuits by positioning the pot on top of the bowl and tilting it so all the content of the pot pours into the bowl.

use the wooden spoon to slide any of the remaining sauce from the pot into the bowl. The pot is positioned on top of the bowl, so any sauce that comes out of it will fall into the bowl. The spoon is moved around the inside of the pot, the bottom and the sides, to slide any remaining sauce into the bowl.

Hold the bowl using the left hand. Hold the wooden spoon using the right hand. Mix the content of the bowl, mixing the hot chocolate sauce with the crushed biscuits by turning the content of the bowl upside down so that the chocolate at the top gets mixed with the biscuits at the bottom.
Hit the wooden spoon against the rim of the bowl to drop the biscuits and chocolate that stuck to it back into the mix.

Hold the wooden spoon with the left hand and use the metallic spoon with the right hand to slide the mixture that stuck to the wooden spoon back into the bowl. As the mixture is very hot, the hand can't be used.
Do the same for the back of the spoon, holding the wooden spoon with the left hand and sliding the mixture stuck to the back of the spoon using the metallic spoon. Back into the bowl.
Continue mixing the bowl's content with the metallic spoon.
Drop some of the remaining mixture stuck to the metallic spoon using the hand back into the bowl.
Go back to mixing the content of the bowl with the wooden spoon as the mixture is still hot, but realize it's now hard to mix using the spoon.
Press the mixture into the bowl using the right hand.
Try to pour the mixture onto the chopping board, but realize it has not mixed correctly, as only the biscuits fall off independently.
Slide back the biscuits from the chopping board into the bowl using the wooden spoon.
Pour the mixture from the bowl onto the chopping board using the wooden spoon to assist with sliding the mixture.
Press the mixture together to form one long continuous roll by pressing on the sides and along its length using the hands and the palm.
Roll the mixture a little towards the edge of the countertop.
Continue pressing the roll along its length using the hands.
Roll the mixture again slightly.
Press the mixture along its length.
Press the two sides of the roll in using both hands.
Continue pressing the mixture using both hands along its length to solidify it.
Roll and press the mixture using both hands on the chopping board.
Gather some of the biscuits that had fallen on the chopping board, press them back into the mixture.
Continue to roll and press until it forms into a uniform width roll.
unroll the foil paper by holding the paper in place, holding the roll with the left hand and pulling its end using the right hand to the required length.
tear the roll around its base to separate the unrolled foil, holding the end with both hands and tearing it off.
holding the end of the roll, tear the rest of the foil by pulling it away.
Place the edge of the foil paper on the chopping board next to the rolled mixture.
Using both hands, lift and place the mixture from the chopping board onto the edge of the foil paper.
Fold the edge of the foil paper onto the mixture and roll the foil paper so it covers the mixture fully.
Pick up the foil paper containing the mixture from the chopping board using both hands.
Try to put the mixture with the foil paper at the lower end of the fridge, pushing it realizing there isn't enough space.
Move the yogurt from the second shelf to the top shelf.
push the butter inside in the second shelf of the fridge.
place the mixture wrapped with foil paper on the second edge of the fridge.

rinse both hands, rubbing them against each other under the tap water to clean the hands from the the mixture and the biscuits and the chocolate but also using the water coming out to soak the bowl under the hands. Also rubbing around the fingertips and the nails during the rinsing.
Pick up the garlic presser from the countertop.
Put the garlic presser in the sink.
Pick up the bowl containing dough that's been covered with towels from the oven. It was put in the oven for proofing.
Lift the two towels off the bowl, uncovering it. The dough has risen sufficiently, holding the edge of the towels and lifting them off.
Put the bowl with the blue towel away, realizing I still need to prepare the filling, so the dough needs to be covered in the meanwhile.
Pour olive oil from the bottle into the tray on the right. This is to oil the tray before the dough can be added to it. Notice that the bottle is already opened so it doesn't need to be opened.

spread the oil onto the surface of the right tray using the fingers of the right hand, placing the fingers flat on the tray and spreading the oil all across the surface of the tray, holding the tray with the left hand to steady it.
Pour olive oil into the second tray, the tray on the left, from the bottle, tilting the bottle to pour the oil.
spread the oil on the surface of the second tray using the four fingers of the right hand, spreading the tray all around the surface, holding the tray with the left hand to steady it.
Wash the right hand from the oil by scrubbing both hands against one another, spreading the soap to wash the hand.
pick up the pan containing cooked meat from the hob. The meat has now cooled, so it's ready to be prepared as a topping on the dough.
pick up a spoon from the cutlery tray in the drawer. The spoon will be used to scoop yogurt from the top.
positioning the tub of yogurt on top of the pan. Scoop one spoonful of yogurt using the spoon. The tub of yogurt is being held with the left hand and the spoon with the right hand.
Pour the spoon of yoghurt on top of the meat in the pan.
pour the yogurt on top of the meat.
Pour the additional yoghurt from the spoon onto the pan with cooked meat.
Cover the yogurt again using the light cover, now covering the top of the tub.
Put down the jar of tahini on the countertop next to the yogurt.
complete opening the jar by rotating the lid fully and lifting it off the jar, turning it upside down so any tahini that is on the inside of the lid does not fall off onto the surface top.

Insert the spoon inside the jar and mix the content of the jar. The tahini gets to separate the oil from the solid parts, so mixing the contents thoroughly before scooping is essential. Insert the spoon and mix thoroughly in circular motions clockwise. Also bringing the bottom content to the top while doing so.

Scoop one spoonful of tahini from the jar using the spoon. The jar is held with the left hand, the spoon with the right hand, and the jar is positioned on top of the pan, so any drops fall into the pan.
Pour the spoonful of tahini on top of the meat and yogurt.
Pour the additional tahini on the pan.
shake the spoon hard on top of the pan to drop the remaining tahini from it. As tahini is really thick, shaking strongly is required.
put down the jar on the countertop with the spoon inside it, keeping the spoon inside the jar so that in case I need to add more tahini after I mix all the ingredients, I can do so.
Turn the lid upside down to use it to measure some of the spice from the jar.

Pour some of the sumac spice from the jar into the lid by holding the jar with the left hand, holding the lid positioned under the jar with the right hand, tilting the jar to pour sumac into the lid. Pouring into the lid allows to take an accurate measurement, so not much sumac drops into the mixture.

Pour the measured sumac from the lid into the pan by turning the lid upside down on top of the pan so the sumac falls from the lid into the pan. Pour the sumac on top of the tahini, yogurt and the cooked meat.
Shake the lid on top of the pan to drop any of the remaining spice from it into the pan.
Pick up the spoon that's resting on the pan. This spoon was used to add the yogurt.

Mix all the ingredients added to the pan with the cooked meat to produce the filling that we'll be using to top the meat doughs or to produce the topping of the meat doughs. First mixing the yogurt, tahini and sumac together and then mixing these with the full content of the pan with all the meat to cover all the meat with this mixture. Also holding the pan's handle with the left hand and rotating the handle to access all the content of the pan during mixing.
stop mixing when I realize that I need to put more tahini as there isn't enough, the mixture is still dry.
Hold the spoon that was resting inside the tahini jar and scoop one handful of tahini from the jar.
Pour the handful of tahini into the pan, shaking the spoon firmly to drop the content into the pan.

holding the spoon that was resting on the pan. Again, mix all the ingredients. The aim is to have a more balanced mixture with enough tahini in the yogurt. Continue mixing all the content, also holding the pan's handle with the left hand and rotating it to access all the content of the pan.
Take a bit of the mixture using the spoon. So take a small amount of meat that has been cooked and covered with the mixture with the spoon to taste.
taste the mixture to check that the amount of spice is sufficient.
Put down the pan with the mixture, the topping on the upper shelf, using the left hand holding the handle.
Lift the towel off the bowl, uncovering the dough, holding it with the right hand from one end and pulling it away
Pick up the bowl with dough from the countertop, holding it with both hands.

Knead the dough, removing the air that has accumulated inside it during proofing, by lifting one edge and then folding it into the center, going across the full edge and going around all around the dough.
Knead by pressing your fist in, then lift the edge and fold it into the center several times to knead the dough removing the air from it.
Cut one small ball of dough from the dough. This is done by holding one end of the dough, squeezing with the right hand and pulling the right size of dough using the left hand.
Knead the ball of dough by squeezing it with one hand and passing it with the other hand, squeezing and passing multiple times. This aims to remove the remaining air from the dough.
attempt to roll the dough into a ball but the dough is very sticky
return the ball of dough into the big ball because it's very sticky so the hands need to be oiled first.
open up the upper cupboard using the handle. The handle is being held with the small finger, the pinky, to avoid spreading the dough that is on the hand on the handle.
Pour oil from the countertop onto the plate. This oil will be used to oil the hand.
Dip the fingers of the right hand into the plate with oil to get some oil from the plate.
Press the fingers of right hand into the palm of the left hand and spread the oil around to oil this palm of the left hand.

Press the fingers into the palm of the left hand and spread the oil again, oiling the palm of the left hand. Oiling will stop the dough from sticking to the hands while kneading and rolling into balls.
Pick up a ball of dough from the big bowl using the right hand
roll the ball of dough by placing the dough on the palm of the left hand and rolling it with the right hand.
Place the ball of dough on one of the corners of the tray using the right hand in preparation for adding more balls of dough into the tray.
Cut another bit of the dough, again by lifting one end of the dough, pinching and squeezing two fingers of the right hand to cut this bit out of the dough and holding the cut bit with the left hand.

Knead the ball of dough by passing it from one hand to the other, squeezing, then passing again to the other hand, then squeezing to get rid of the air. This is the method for kneading the ball of dough.
Roll the ball of dough by placing it on the palm of the left hand and rolling with the right hand.
kneading the dough.
Rolling the dough.

Put the dough on the tray.

Try to shape the dough into a ball by pulling its ends and putting them at the bottom of the dough.

Try to shape the dough into a ball by pulling the ends under the dough using both hands.
Place the dough on the tray and again try to shape it into a ball using the fingers as it's really soft, and sticky.

Pick up the pan containing the meat topping from the upper shelf by holding the handle with the left hand and holding the spoon that has been resting on the pan and the meat using the right hand.

Using the fingers of the right hand, pinch some of the meat topping from the pan, holding the pan with the left hand from its handle. This is an amount of topping that is suitable to be placed on the dough.

Add more meat topping to the same bowl of dough by pressing it into the center, pushing inside using the hand and then tapping with the fingers to ensure it stays in place slightly into the dough.

add the meat topping to the last topped ball of dough using the right hand.

Hold the handle of the spoon using the left hand and pass the fingers of the right hand around the spoon surface to gather the remaining meat that is stuck on the surface of the spoon. To add this to the topping.
Put the topped meat inside the pan and gather all the remaining meat topping from the pan by passing the fingers around the surface of the hand. The spoon is being held with the left hand.
Scoop all the gathered meat topping from the pan using the right hand's fingers. The pan is being held with the left hand.
Place all the remaining meat topping on the last ball of dough in the pan.

Rinse the right hand that has been used to scoop and pick meat from the pan using the water from the tap, positioning the hands on top of the pan so the water is also used to soak the pan, scrubbing the hand, the right hand, using the left hand while rinsing it.

Tap the spoon against the rim of the jar, holding the jar with the left hand and tapping the spoon with the right hand, so that some of the contents stuck to the spoon of the tahini can fall back into the jar, tapping it multiple times while walking.

Put the yogurt on the upper shelf in the fridge to the right.
Turn off the hob under the carrot soup. The carrot soup is now ready.
Lift the lid off the pot of the soup of carrots, exposing the soup's content and the steam comes out of the soup.
Move the milk frother on the counter top further from the edge to empty space.

pick up the pot containing the cooked carrot from the hob by holding the handle with the right hand. Notice that the pot contains very hot boiling water and carrots. It had just been switched off. So maintain the distance between the hand and the pot.
Dip the end of the blender into the pot with the carrot soup, preparing to blend it.
Push the blender down into the soup, blending the carrots that are under the blender as you push down.
Continue pressing the power button as you dip the blender in and out of the pot in various random locations to blend the remaining carrot pieces.
Keeping the power button on and the blender's end into the soup, move the blender in circular motions around the pot to keep blending the soup.
Move the blender around the soup, checking for any carrot pieces and moving them around without switching the blender off, just using it as if it's a spoon.
Turn on the blender by pressing the button using the right thumb and move the blender around the pot in circular fashion to blend the remainder of the soup into a smooth mixture.
Start the blender again by pressing the button and dip the head of the blender again into the pot, moving it around to continue to blend the soup, in circular quick clockwise motion.
Turn on the blender by pressing the button, lift and dip the blender and continue blending moving the blender around the pot, in circular motions.
Turn on the blender by pressing the button using the thumb of the left hand and moving the blender around the soup in the pot.
Turn on the blender by pressing the button and move the blender around the soup in the pot by rotating the blender in circular motions.
Turn on the blender again by pressing the button and rotating the blender around the soup in circular motion. This is to cover all the soup and any remaining unblended carrot pieces.
Turn the lid upside down to use it to measure the amount of spice and position the spices jar on top of the lid to pour spice.

Pour some spice from the jar of spice into the lid that's being held with the right hand to measure the amount of spice roughly. Pouring into the lid rather than directly into the soup would avoid pouring too much.

Pour the spice from the lid into the soup by positioning the lid on top of the pot containing the carrot soup and then flipping the lid upside down so the spice that has been measured into the lid is poured into the soup to season it.
Shake the lid once on top of the pot to drop any of the spice still inside it into the pot.
Place the blender on top of the soup, on top of the part where the spice has been added, and push the blender down into the soup, effectively pushing the spice in the soup, mixing it in.
Move the blender in circular motions in the soup, effectively stirring the spice into the soup using the blender without turning the blender on. So effectively using it as a spoon or a mixer.
Blend the soup by moving the blender in circular motions around the soup.
Keep the blender positioned inside the soup, keeping it standing upright while its head is dipped into the soup, releasing it from the hand.
Dip the teaspoon into the soup in the pot, scooping a bit of the soup from the edge of the pot in order to taste it.
Taste a bit of the soup on the spoon to test the seasoning of the soup, only tasting a little bit of the soup as it's still hot.
